Yes! I didn't do a full comparison on diagramming tools. I've used mermaid, plant uml and others. One thing I liked about this was the python structure was very intuitive over the others. The auto routing was phenomenal as well. For a quick chart mermaid/plantuml are great.

data.content:
A little template project i threw together for doing diagrams as code. Added some helpers in there so can chart lines in a simple command delimited list and it automatically does a nice layout!

github.com/sheldonhull/di‚Ä¶

Blog post supporting this:
sheldonhull.com/diagrams-as-co‚Ä¶

You hadn‚Äôt mentioned PlantUML, so I thought it worth pointing to: plantuml.com It‚Äôs default output is ‚Ä¶ bleah. But, there are lots of PlantUML additions that do C4 diagrams and now there is theme support, and these look a lot better. Not as flexible as Python.
